questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'steady'?
questions.explanation: Steady means stable or firm; 'shaky' means unstable.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'permit'?
questions.explanation: Permit means allow; 'forbid' means refuse permission.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'gain'?
questions.explanation: Gain means increase or obtain; 'lose' is its direct opposite.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'public'?
questions.explanation: Public means open to everyone; 'private' means meant for one person or group.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'obedient'?
questions.explanation: Obedient means following orders; 'defiant' means openly resisting.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'reduce'?
questions.explanation: Reduce means make smaller; 'increase' means make larger.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'occupied'?
questions.explanation: Occupied means in use or busy; 'free' means available.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'accept'?
questions.explanation: Accept means agree to receive; 'reject' means refuse to receive.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'distant'?
questions.explanation: Distant means far away; 'close' means near.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'attentive'?
questions.explanation: Attentive means paying close attention; 'distracted' means not focused.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'accept'?
questions.explanation: Accept vs 'refuse' is a direct antonym pair often used in test questions.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'rough'?
questions.explanation: Rough means uneven or coarse; 'smooth' means even and without bumps.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'simple'?
questions.explanation: Simple means easy or not complicated; 'complex' means complicated or detailed.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'allow'?
questions.explanation: Allow means let something happen; 'refuse' means not allow it.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'expand'?
questions.explanation: Again, expand vs 'contract' is a standard opposite pair in vocabulary tests.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'steady'?
questions.explanation: Steady means stable; 'unstable' means not steady.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'rare'?
questions.explanation: Rare means not common; 'common' is the straightforward opposite.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'active'?
questions.explanation: Active means moving or engaged; 'still' means not moving.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'tight'?
questions.explanation: Tight means firmly fixed; 'loose' means not tight or easily moved.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'shorten'?
questions.explanation: Shorten means make smaller in length; 'lengthen' means make longer.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'generous'?
questions.explanation: Generous means giving freely; 'selfish' means focused only on oneself.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'murky'?
questions.explanation: Murky means dark or unclear; 'clear' means easy to see through.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'strict'?
questions.explanation: Strict vs 'lenient' is a classic antonym pair in exam vocab.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'vertical'?
questions.explanation: Vertical means up-and-down; 'horizontal' means side-to-side.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'foolish'?
questions.explanation: Foolish means lacking good sense; 'wise' means showing good judgment.
